sentences.english: She start complaining and m aunts, said m blue too have an idea.
sentences.chinese: 羅梅開始和米嬸訴苦，說米藍“太”有主意了。

sentences.english: Tassels on the horns of a dilemma, back to the husbands family and no steps, had to find treasure complex complaint.
sentences.chinese: 流蘇進退兩難，回婆家又沒臺階，只得找寶絡訴苦。

sentences.english: Workers complain to the boss of their overwork.
sentences.chinese: 因爲工作過度，工人向老闆訴苦。

sentences.english: But I would not sadden you by the mortal plaint.
sentences.chinese: 但是我不會用這致命的訴苦來使你憂傷。

sentences.english: He sat in a corner of the room canting and whining.
sentences.chinese: 他坐在房間的一個角落裏一邊哀求一邊訴苦。

sentences.english: The old woman bleated (out) her complaints.
sentences.chinese: 老婦人以顫抖的聲音訴苦。

sentences.english: He who makes constish complaint gets little compbuttion.
sentences.chinese: 時常訴苦銜恨，難以取得憐憫。

sentences.english: Mmuch people complain that computers take over their jobaloney.
sentences.chinese: 許多人訴苦說計算機正在收受人的作事。

sentences.english: A tramp came and made a poor mouth to Mrs Robeson.
sentences.chinese: 一流浪漢走來向羅伯遜夫人叫窮訴苦。

sentences.english: Bing and argue, honor with customers, we appealed to grasp bitterness toward refers to a third party.
sentences.chinese: 秉又與客戶爭執，榮勸解秉，秉向榮訴苦指有第三者。

sentences.english: Palmer the temple to find their own lover complaining of elder sister Ann.
sentences.chinese: 帕巴坦去找自己的相好頌安大姐訴苦。

sentences.english: Naomi gets into God's story by complaining.
sentences.chinese: 拿俄米在神的故事中以訴苦出場。

sentences.english: Then don’t complain to me when Spanish gets boring.
sentences.chinese: 當你覺得西班牙語令你厭煩的時候，別向我訴苦。

sentences.english: His amiability condemns him to being a constant listener to other people's troubles.
sentences.chinese: 他的和藹可親使他經常處於傾聽他人訴苦的地位。

sentences.english: Meaning : (Informal) To complain naggingly or constantly; grumble.
Her constant complaining just sticks in my craw .
sentences.chinese: 她那不斷的訴苦真使我受不了。

definition: to enquire solicitously about sb's well-being (idiom)/to pamper
unimportant/not serious/it doesn't matter/never mind/it looks all right, but
to lament/to complain tearfully/to wail accusingly
to go mad/to go crazy/to lose one's mind
to ask about/to make some inquiries/to ask around
not to hear, not to question (idiom)/to show no interest in sth/uncritical/not in the least concerned
bored/fed up with sth/sick of sth
easy to deal with/not a problem/(polite answer) you flatter me
to come to sb's door/to call on sb
